approbation(profils: dict, approval_radius: int) → tuple[str, bool, list] | None[source]

Approval voting system (système de vote par approbation).

In this voting system, voters can show support for one or more candidates by voting “yes / no” for each one. Approval is given if the voter is within an approval circle whose radius is defined by the user.

Parameters:

  • profils – Scores for each voter

  • approval_radius – Radius of the approval circle

Returns:

tuple(str(winner label), bool(multiple winners?), list(all winners’ labels))

borda(profils: dict, maximum: int, step: int) → tuple[str, bool, list][source]

Returns the winner according to Borda voting method.

In this system, the candidates are given a score based on the maximum score given by the user. The first candidate received the max points, the second -> max-step, the third -> max-2*step, … If the number of candidates is higher than max, the remaining candidates [max; nb_candidates] will receive the score of 0. In case of equality, the function returns the first in alphabetical order.

Parameters:

  • step – step between two scores (ex: if max=100 and step=5, score attribution: 100, 95, 90, …)

  • profils – dictionary of votes registered by the voters

  • maximum – maximum score to attribute to the top candidate

Returns:

tuple(str(winner label), bool(multiple winners?), list(all winners’ labels))

condorcet(profils: dict, method: CondorcetMethod, tie_breaking_rule: CondorcetTieBreakingRule) → tuple[str, bool, bool, list | None] | None[source]

Condorcet voting system.

In this voting system, we start by generating pairs for each 2 candidates and organizing duels between them. In order to win, the candidate’s score must be strictly greater than his opponent’s. In the case of a tie, neither the candidate nor their opponent are added to any of the “wins” or “losses” tables: we simply do nothing.

If a candidate wins all his duels (loses none), then he is the Condorcet winner.

If not, we resort to using the method given as an argument to the method.

If there are multiple winners, we use the tie-breaking rule given as argument.

Parameters:

  • profils – Scores for each voter

  • method – Method to use in case there is no Condorcet winner

  • tie_breaking_rule – Tie-breaking rule to use in order to decide who wins

Returns:

tuple(

str(winner label), bool(used given method?), bool(used tie-breaking rule?), list(all winners’ labels)

)

data_manager = <data_manager.DataManager object>
elimination_successive(profils: dict) → tuple[str, bool, list][source]

Returns the winner according to Single transferable vote (STV) system. Eliminates the last candidate in alphabetical order in case of equality.

Parameters:

profils – dictionary of the scores of each voter

Returns:

tuple(str(winner label), bool(multiple winners?), list(all winners’ labels))

pluralite_simple(profils: dict) → tuple[str, bool, list][source]

Returns the winner according to simple majority voting method. Returns the first in alphabetical order in case of equality.

Parameters:

profils – dictionary of votes registered by the voters

Returns:

tuple(str(winner label), bool(multiple winners?), list(all winners’ labels))

veto(profils: dict) → tuple[str, bool, list][source]

Implementation of veto sorting method : 0 for the last candidate in each profil, 1 for the rest

Parameters:

profils – dictionary of votes registered by the voters

Returns:

tuple(str(winner label), bool(multiple winners?), list(all winners’ labels))
